H0.text: What type of seaweed grows up to 100 meters in length, and is farmed for its alginates. Dulse

H1.text: What type of seaweed grows up to 100 meters in length, and is farmed for its alginates. Irish Moss

H2.text: What type of seaweed grows up to 100 meters in length, and is farmed for its alginates. Wakame

H3.text: What type of seaweed grows up to 100 meters in length, and is farmed for its alginates. Kelp

A4.text: Alginate, a kelp-derived carbohydrate, is used to thicken products such as ice cream, jelly, salad dressing, and toothpaste, as well as an ingredient in exotic dog food and in manufactured goods.

A5.text: They are known for their fast growth â€”the genera Macrocystis and Nereocystis can grow as fast as half a metre a day (that is, about 20 inches a day), ultimately reaching 30 to 80 metres (100 to 260 ft).

A6.text: All brown algae contain alginic acid (alginate) in their cell walls, which is extracted commercially and used as an industrial thickening agent in food and for other uses.

A7.text: Macrocystis, a kelp of the order Laminariales, may reach 60 m (200 ft) in length.
